wikipedia_page.main: Joseph Emmanuel Benjamin (2 February 1961 – 8 March 2021) was a St Kitts–born English cricketer who played in one Test and two ODIs from 1994 to 1995.  He also played county cricket for Warwickshire and Surrey from 1988 to 1999.

link_mentions.page: English cricket team in Australia in 1994–95
response: England's selection for the tour was predictable, with the experienced Mike Gatting being added to the squads that had toured the West Indies and enjoyed success in home series against New Zealand and South Africa. Joey Benjamin and Martin McCague were recalled to the bowling after successful county seasons. Mike Atherton again captained the team, rallying after the summer indiscretions at Lord's though it appeared he was less than happy at the selections that had been made.

Of the bowlers, Gough was the most successful, picking up 20 wickets at 21.25, and was well backed up by Lewis (11 at 22.64) and Fraser (14 at 27.79), but otherwise the figures were badly affected by the dropped catches. McCague hardly bowled after his failure in the first Test, and Joey Benjamin didn't figure at all.

link_mentions.page: South African cricket team in England in 1994
response: South Africa dropped Hudson for the Final Test after his run of low scores and Peter Kirsten moved up to open the batting with his brother, while Daryll Cullinan came into the middle order.  Donald recovered from his sore toe to lead the bowling attack.  Fraser and Tufnell were left out of the England side from the Second Test, with Devon Malcolm coming in to make use of the pace of the pitch and Surrey's Joey Benjamin making his Test debut in an all-seam attack.  The selectors no doubt hoped he could use his knowledge of conditions at The Oval to supplement his fast-medium pace.
